Here's some code.

Tic-Tac-Toe with OpenGLUT

I always looked at my console tic-tac-toe implementations with such disdain, mainly because you can't point and click to place down a piece. I decided one day to do something about that, and while I'm trying something new, might as well try something REALLY new, and go take a giant peek at one of those things I never really understood, OpenGL.

Ridiculous Full Line Justification

I did this for my programming class. It's a ridiculously complex implementation, but it works. The main issue was that there's really no simple way to find the next character that wasn't a space in C++ without using confusing substring searches. So I decided to just implement it directly.
